channel.title: Please help me!
channel.description:
how can i change colour of this item? and dont just post ''get a guide'' or ''use the search button''
if(i == 9145) // change this if you need to "item number" { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anInt174 = 4681; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 900;//Model Zoom class8.anInt190 = 540;//Model Rotation class8.anInt198 = 2039;//model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt199 = 0;//noteable class8.anInt169 = 0;// model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 0;//model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 4682;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 4683;//female wearing class8.anInt164 = 4685;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = 4684;//male arms/sleeves class8.anInt175 = -1;//Unknown class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Soulero's Plate";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Soulero's Powerful plate".getBytes();//examin info }
this whas the codes that i added to class8 (fully working) but how can i change the colour of it?
[im sry for spamming this topic but no one really answer it]

item.title: Please help me!

item.description:
@souleroo wrote:

this doesnt help me at all i dont know the orginal colours of bandos plate and that text code that i sended doesnt saywhat colours it has -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me!
item.dc:creator: @mLexus mLexus
item.description:
@mLexus wrote:

#################################################
###########Galkons Recoloring Guide##############
#################################################

Okay, this is my guide to recoloring. It has all the basic information you need.

Step 1: Find an item you want to recolor. There are some items in class8.java

Step 2: Here is a "map" on what is what:

if(i == ####){//item ID
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];//dont need to change
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";//equip type
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];//NUMBER OF ORIGINAL COLORS
class8.anIntArray160 = new int [1];//NUMBER OF CHANGED COLORS
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 926;//ORIGINAL COLOR, 926 = dragon red
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 128;//CHANGED COLOR(want to know this)
class8.anInt174 = 2635;
class8.anInt181 = 440;
class8.anInt190 = 76;
class8.anInt198 = 1850;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 1;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 187;
class8.anInt200 = 363;
class8.anInt175 = 29;
class8.anInt197 = 87;
class8.aString170 = "Item";//ITEM NAME
class8.aByteArray178 = "Item Description".getBytes();//ITEM DESCRIPTION (EXAMINE INFO)
}

Step 3: Understanding the color ints.


class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];          <--- This is the amount of original colors, this says there is 1 color

class8.anIntArray156[0] = 926;           <--- This is the first, and only original color. The colors always start at [0]

class8.anIntArray160 = new int [1];         <--- This is the amount of changed color, this says there is 1 color

class8.anIntArray160[0] = 128;          <--- This is the first, and only changed color, this is the first color, its [0]


If an item has more than 1 color, you will need more than 1 int. An item with more than one color would look like this:

if(i == ####){//item ID
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[4];       <---- 4 original colors
class8.anIntArray160 = new int [4];        <---- 4 changed colors
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 1;     \
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 2;	  \
class8.anIntArray156[1] = 3;	   \
class8.anIntArray160[1] = 4;	    \These are all the original and changed colors. 156 being original, 160 being changed
class8.anIntArray156[2] = 5;	    /
class8.anIntArray160[2] = 6;	   /
class8.anIntArray156[3] = 7;      /
class8.anIntArray160[3] = 8;	 /
class8.anInt174 = 2635;
class8.anInt181 = 440;
class8.anInt190 = 76;
class8.anInt198 = 1850;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 1;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 187;
class8.anInt200 = 363;
class8.anInt175 = 29;
class8.anInt197 = 87;
class8.aString170 = "Item";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Item Description".getBytes();
}


Step 4: Changing a color

To change a color, you must know the original and new color ID.
Lets say you want to change something red to black.

You would find:

class8.anIntArray156[0] = 926;//dragon red

and change the 926(dragon red), to 0(black). It would then look like this:

class8.anIntArray156[0] = 0;//dragon red



~END~
This is all I can think of to help you out. You will get the hang of it sooner or later.

Hope this helped.



##############################################
----Galkon(GalkonsPride of Mopar)
##############################################

uhu

Read full topic

item.title: Please help me!
item.dc:creator: @souleroo souleroo
item.description:
@souleroo wrote:

how can i change colour of this item? and dont just post ‘‘get a guide’’ or ‘‘use the search button’’

if(i == 9145) // change this if you need to “item number”
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;//New option
class8.anInt174 = 4681; //Model ID
class8.anInt181 = 900;//Model Zoom
class8.anInt190 = 540;//Model Rotation
class8.anInt198 = 2039;//model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle
class8.anInt199 = 0;//noteable
class8.anInt169 = 0;// model offset increase to move to the right
class8.anInt194 = 0;//model offset increase to move up
class8.anInt165 = 4682;//male wearing
class8.anInt200 = 4683;//female wearing
class8.anInt164 = 4685;//Female arms/sleeves
class8.anInt188 = 4684;//male arms/sleeves
class8.anInt175 = -1;//Unknown
class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable
class8.aString170 = “Soulero’s Plate”;//Name of the new item
class8.aByteArray178 = “Soulero’s Powerful plate”.getBytes();//examin info
}

this whas the codes that i added to class8 (fully working) but how can i change the colour of it?

[im sry for spamming this topic but no one really answer it]

Read full topic
